uk.co.datumedge.redislauncher

Class AlwaysDestroyLifecyclePolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.datumedge.redislauncher.AlwaysDestroyLifecyclePolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LifecyclePolicy

    public final class AlwaysDestroyLifecyclePolicy
extends Object
implements LifecyclePolicy
    A lifecycle policy that destroys the server when an exception occurs, or when the JVM terminates.

    • Method Detail

      • failedToStart

        public void failedToStart(RedisServer redisServer)
        Invoked when the server failed to start, or it could not be determined that the server has started. This implementation destroys the redisServer.
        Specified by:
        failedToStart in interface LifecyclePolicy
        Parameters:
        redisServer - the server which failed to start

      • failedToStop

        public void failedToStop(RedisServer redisServer,
                Throwable cause)
                  throws FailedToStopException
        Invoked when the server failed to stop, or it could not be determined that the server has stopped. This implementation destroys the redisServer.
        Specified by:
        failedToStop in interface LifecyclePolicy
        cause - the cause
        Throws:
        FailedToStopException - optionally thrown by the implementing class

      • getProcessDestroyer

        public org.apache.commons.exec.ProcessDestroyer getProcessDestroyer()
        Description copied from interface: LifecyclePolicy
        Get a ProcessDestroyer that can be used to destroy a redis server outside of its normal lifecycle. This is useful for destroying a redis server process when the JVM terminates, for example. An implementation should return NullProcessDestroyer.INSTANCE if no special behaviour is needed.
        Specified by:
        getProcessDestroyer in interface LifecyclePolicy
        Returns:
        a ProcessDestroyer instance
